AVSEC ORDER 7/2000 
 
SUB : DUMMY CHECK 
 
 
1. 
In exercise of the powers, conferred by Section 5A of the Aircraft Act, 
1934 (XXII of 1934/S.O. 1797/97), the Commissioner of Security, Civil Aviation, 
for the purpose of security of the aircraft operations, directs that in order to assess 
the effectiveness of security controls in respect of anti-hijacking, anti-sabotage 
security measures and enforcement of access control system in accordance with 
the guidelines issued by the Bureau from time to time which as to be implemented 
by security staff of the Airport Security Unit, Air Operators and Airport Operators 
concerned at the civil airports in India, besides the officers of the Bureau of Civil 
Aviation Security and the officers of CISF, the officers of State/UT police may 
conduct such tests with or without dummy weapons, such security controls at the 
airports where CISF has been deployed for aviation security duties, after 
obtaining authorization in writing from Commissioner of Security, Civil Aviation 
for  conducting such tests.  Immediately after the dummy check, the result and 
comments should be sent to the BCAS Hqrs and the airport Director concerned.  
In order to take follow up action, monthly report of dummy checks conducted by 
the CISF and police officers at Airports maybe sent to this Bureau regularly every 
month. 
   (VEERANNA AIVALLI) 
COMMISSIONER OF SECURITY(CA) 
 
REF.NO. CAS-6(4)/99-DIV-I 
Dated : 15.11.2000 
 
AVSEC ORDER 8 / 2000 
 
SUB : SKY MARSHALL- MEDICAL INSPECTION 
 
1. 
In exercise of the powers, conferred by Section 5A of the Aircraft Act, 
1934 (XXII of 1934/S.O. 1797/97), the Commissioner of Security, Civil Aviation, 
for the purpose of security of the aircraft operations, directs that no person acting 
as, or carried in aircraft for the purpose of acting as Sky Marshall shall have taken 
or used any alcoholic drink, sedative, narcotic or stimulant drug or preparation 
within 12 hours of the commencement of the flight or take or use any such 
preparation in the course of the flight, and no such person shall , while so acting 
or carried, be in a state of intoxication or have detectable blood  alcohol 
whatsoever in his breath, urine or blood alcohol analysis or in a state in which by 
reason of his having taken any alcoholic, sedative narcotic or stimulant drug or 
preparation his capacity so to act is impaired, and no other person while in a state 
of intoxication shall enter or be in aircraft.

2. 
The Sky Marshals shall be subjected to medical check-up by the 
authorized medical practitioner of the concerned Air Operator on which the Sky 
Marshals are assigned duties.  A record of such checks will be maintained by the 
airlines concerned for any subsequent inspection/verification by the competent 
authority. 
 
3. 
In case the sky Marshal is found under intoxication / Influence of alcohol / 
other drugs, he shall not be allowed to undertake the assignment of Sky Marshal 
and necessary action will be taken by D.G.N.S.G. 
 
 (VEERANNA AIVALLI) 
COMMISSIONER OF SECURITY 
 
 
REF.NO. CAS-41(1)/2000-DIV-I, Dated : 19.12.2000
